item.title: Lally Seeking Interest in Multidisciplinary Student Consultancy Club
item.description: Lally School of Management is looking to support a multidisciplinary student consultancy club that will be open to all RPI students, supported by Lally, and have leadership that includes students in Lally majors. The consultancy’s mission will be to foster and facilitate challenge-based learning through project-oriented management consulting. Please take a moment to complete this form if you’re interested in taking on such a leadership position!

item.title: Dave Bebb to Lead December 14 EMPAC Tour
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 14, 2024 11:00 AM - Join Senior Network Administrator Dave Bebb and tour EMPAC’s advanced capabilities from an information technology perspective! With miles of fiber optic cable linking all four venues as well as the audio and video recording facilities, EMPAC is a phenomenal environment where physical and digital worlds seamlessly intersect on a human scale. There’s always something new to learn and discover!
item.author: Community

item.title: Charles Curtis to Play “Nadjorlak” by Éliane Radigue
item.description: Date: Friday, December 13, 2024 7:00 PM - Composed specifically for internationally acclaimed cellist Charles Curtis and premiered in 2005, French composer Éliane Radigue’s hour-long “Naldjorlak” exists at the instrument’s limits—at the threshold of resonance and its disappearance. Performed in EMPAC Studio 2, with a reception to follow, this performance is a rare opportunity to experience its intensity up-close!

item.title: Dr. Yinan Wang Selected for IBM-RPI FCRC Project
item.description: Dr. Yinan Wang’s proposal, “Model Optimization and Hardware-aware Neural Architecture Search for Spatiotemporal Data Mining,” was selected as a Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC) project, a partnership between RPI and IBM. This research program is focused on developing a comprehensive framework for hardware-aware neural architecture search and model optimization for on-edge spatiotemporal data mining.

item.title: HelioCampus Syllabus Available for Spring ‘25 Term
item.description:
The HelioCampus syllabus module is available for faculty to access for the spring beginning on December 12, 2024. Per requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published by January 20, 2025, two weeks after the start of classes.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
